Fields.DialogueText: Il nemico si sta avvicinando! Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Lampo, are you all right?
Sì, sto bene, Capitano. We sure showed that Morgana not to mess with us, didn't we?
You don't look all right. You have wounds all over you.
Oh, those are no big deal. I'll get over them. Now, if you'll excuse me...
Where are you going?
I need to check on a project I was tinkering with just before the attack. The fight probably jostled it around, and I want to make sure nothing was damaged.
You should rest before you focus on other things.
I'll be fine. Why are you so worried?

Fields.MenuText: Because partners look out for each other.
What's so important about your project?
It just seems like you don't care about yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Capitano. But that's why I can't let myself slack off. I need to be able to protect you and my crew as well.
That's a secret! But suffice it to say, it's something that will change the world.
I do care about myself! I believe in myself, and I believe that nothing can stop me. That's why I don't need to worry about myself. I only need to worry about helping everyone else.
Could you please just take it easy for a little bit, Lampo? Consider it a reward for all your hard work.
I guess I have no choice, then. Might as well, if only so I'm ready for the next attack.
Good. It's about time that I take some rest, too.
Vediamo. If I stretch out the corridors along the deck here, as long as I keep the overall shape the same...
What are you working on, Lampo?
Just a little remodeling I came up with for the ship. What do you think?
Okay, I'll take a look. It looks... interesting, but I don't know what that large oval you've drawn over the blueprint is supposed to be.
That's a racetrack.
A... racetrack.
Sì! It took a lot of work to figure out a way to insert it without interfering with crew stationing or the general stability of the vessel, but I found just the right placement.
Now all I need to do is find the best place for the start and finish line. Do you think it should be more toward the bow or the stern?

Fields.MenuText: We cannot have a racetrack on board a warship.
Why a racetrack, of all things?
I don't think there's enough room on board.

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? It could have uses outside of recreation, you know. Imagine having the cars speeding around during combat, providing ready transportation throughout the ship.
Car races are splendid! The sense of excitement as you speed along the track, pushing past whatever obstacles you face until you reach the goal line. It's just so exhilarating!
Okay, maybe it would be a little cramped. But it would be really neat, right?
I guess this wasn't the best idea. Sorry.
Don't be. You put a lot of thought into this. I just don't think it's appropriate while the war is still going on.
Is that all that matters?
What was that?
Oh, nothing! Niente! In any case, I've detected Morganas close by.
@BATTLE
Would that actually work?
... Maybe?
Salve, Capitano.
Hello, Lampo. What are you doing with those paintings?
These are some copies of the finest futurist works from Italy. I was thinking of using them to decorate some of the quarters.
With my permission?
Certamente. Is that permissible, Capitano? I believe they would improve morale.

Fields.MenuText: No, they would get damaged too easily.
Go ahead, but be careful with them.
Why futurism in particular?

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I will need to first develop a way to more safely preserve them while we're at sea. I will start on that immediately.
Thank you, Capitano. I will take the utmost care of these paintings.
That sort of art just appeals to me, I guess. It's so... lively and energetic, like you're racing forward and the world is a blur.
In any case, here's one for your office.
Interesting. What is it?
The City Rises, by Umberto Boccioni. It's one of the best, in my opinion.
It does have a colorful flair to it. Though it looks to me like the city is on fire.
I always thought that there wasn't a city there to begin with. That's a ship pushing past the flames, to a new future.
Interesting perspective. Hopefully, we can get out of our own fire - those Morganas look especially dangerous.
No need to worry. Full steam ahead!
@BATTLE
What's wrong, Lampo? You seem bothered by something.
I received a message from Rome regarding an idea I had. They're going to run a few tests and look into it more.
That's great! So... what's the problem?
Well, when Pola contacted me about it...
Pola? Oh, I see where this is going. What did she say this time?
She said... that I should stop making prank calls unless I come up with something serious for a change. But I was serious! I don't know... maybe she's right.

Fields.MenuText: What was your proposal?
You said that the others liked the idea, though.
Don't give up. This just means you'll have to try harder.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought that large mobile balls, ones that naturally roll around, could be a useful form of transportation, drawing on gravity for movement.
... They did, but Pola's never been afraid of throwing her weight around. And I don't want to let anyone down.
You're right! I will fulfill my duty, no matter what.
It just bothers me that you let this pressure get to you. Normally, you're the last person I would expect to see down.
I... just don't want to fail. We all just have to do our best, and more. The future awaits those who give everything!
Is it worth giving up who you are, though?
It has to be, otherwise our sacrifices will have been for nothing.
*ALARM*
So what are we waiting for? Another Morgana down, another step toward glory for the world! Andiamo!
I just hope that that future includes you, Lampo.
@BATTLE
... Like giant marbles?
It's kind of silly, isn't it?
It's... unique. But what matters is that you put your heart into it.
You're not letting anyone down as long as you are doing something positive. If they want more than they expected, that's their problem, not yours.
There! That should do it.
Look at you with your smock and easel - trying to become the next Picasso?
I'm thinking more of a Boccioni. Boxes are nice, but I'm trying to go for something more vivid and fluid.
Is this your first try?
Yes, I only just started today, so I am still trying to get the hang of it. So, anyway, what do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Really good!
I can't really say. I'm not an expert in this style.
Needs a little more color.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you like it.
That doesn't matter. True art should be able to speak to you no matter your background.
Good point. I'll just add those finishing touches, and it will be ready to go.
What is it, exactly? It's kind of abstract, but it looks like a city in the clouds. Or maybe I got mixed up somewhere.
No, you're right. I call it, "Aetherial Babylon, A Work in Progress."
Looks like it's almost finished.
Yes, and this is just the beginning.
What do you mean?
We'll have to talk later. I've detected a Morgana to our port side. Help me secure my painting, please? Time to charge into the fray!
@BATTLE
Lampo, where are you?!
Sono qui - just give me a second!
We don't have time to waste! A Morgana is heading straight for us!
I just need to fix one thing. I figured out what I need to do, and I can't let this bit of inspiration slip away.

Fields.MenuText: Well, hurry up!
You can work on that later. We have more important things to worry about.
Anything I can do to help you finish?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, you know me. Once I'm done here, I'll be ready for battle in a flash.
This is important, too! The Morganas need to be stopped, but we need to think of other things as well. Like the future.
Sure! Just hand me that wrench over there, and we'll be done in a jiffy.
There! That should do it.
Now are you ready? Lampo?
Andiamo, Capitano! There's no time to waste! I'm speeding the ship into range right now!
Someday, you'll have to tell me what you're actually trying to do with all of this.
@BATTLE
Oh, Sole Mio! Sta 'nfronte a te!
Lampo?
Good day, Capitano. Smooth day for sailing, isn't it?
What's with the gondolier equipment?
I'm trying to get insights into the character of gondoliers. Was my singing acceptable?
Pretty good, but a little off-key.
Well, that's not that important, really. I was more trying to get their perspective on Venice.
What do you mean by that?
Venice is kind of like my painting. It's a city of lovely art floating on the waves and tides. Do you think I'm like Venice in a way?

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you kind of speedy for a gondolier?
Yes, you're just as beautiful as that city.
Sorry, the two of you don't seem to match.

Fields.DialogueText: Certo che lo sono. Just because I admire Venice doesn't mean that I see no means for improvement. Tell me, what do you think about rocket motor gondolas?
Why, grazie, Capitano! Though I like to think that I have my own unique charm, too.
That's okay. I take pride in my own strengths and creativity. So, once I combine that with Venice's grace and hope, I can forge a new path toward the future.
So what are you trying to do, make yourself into a mobile Venice? If it's like the racetrack idea, I'm afraid it won't work for the moment.
No, it's not for me, directly. It's for a project I have in mind.
And that project is... ?
So what do you think of this next verse? Quanno fa notte e 'o sole se ne scene...
*ALARM*
How rude of that Morgana to interrupt our operetta. Why don't we give it a finale to remember?
@BATTLE
Lampo, are you in here?
Ehi! Careful, or you might...
*THUD*
Trip and fall.
Lampo, why are there a bunch of grape vines in this corridor?
I thought I would try to set up a vineyard. I can move the plants to the side if they're too much of an obstruction.
Thanks, I guess. Just make sure no one trips... wait. A vineyard?!
Yes, for the Lampo Winery. I've even made a few samples. Not as fine as an Aglianico, but not too bad. Here, try a sip!

Fields.MenuText: Get rid of all this on the double.
Can't you grow something else if you want to start a garden?
The grapes are fine, but the alcohol is going too far.

Fields.DialogueText: *sigh*... Sì, Capitano. I just wanted to help.
Buona idea. I could grow potatoes - or maybe coconuts.
È un punto giusto. Much as I'd love a glass of Aglianico every night, there are rules to follow while we're at sea.
Well, at least the overall experiment was a success.
Experiment? Do you mean the winery or the grapes?
Both! Anyway, how did the wine taste?
A little rough, but that's to be expected. You rushed it, didn't you?
That's me, all right, speeding forward to the finish line! But let's lay off the champagne for now. We have some Morganas incoming.
@BATTLE
While I go bananas.
Lampo, could I have a word with you, please?
Certo - just give me a second to wrap up this project.
That's what I wanted to ask you about. What is all of this leading up to?
... Actually, I'm kind of busy right now. What if you ask me again later?
Lampo. Every time I ask, you make some sort of excuse. I want to know what's going on.
Look, it's not really that important. It's nothing that will make an impact on the war effort. It's just... a little hobby I have.

Fields.MenuText: Do you trust me?
Lampo, I order you to tell me.
All right, I understand.

Fields.DialogueText: I... guess so. It's just... I was worried that you might make fun of me.
I hear and obey, Capitano.
On second thought, I probably should tell you. Just... promise you won't laugh.
It's a plan for a floating city. I'm thinking of making it a mix of Rome, Florence, and Venice, but that's still up in the air.
I thought that you said this wasn't militarily important? With the right kinds of modifications...
I don't just want it to be for war, Capitano. I want to make something that will last for ages to come, long after this battle's been forgotten.
Then... I hope you succeed.
Capitano...
Come on. We're approaching the rendezvous point, so we need to get ready.
Bene. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
Haha! Correte quanto vi piace, Morganas! You're not getting away this time!
Lampo!
What's that, Capitano? I can't hear you - the wind's too loud!
I said, slow down! We're going to crash into something!
Scusa, Capitano, I can't stop! Otherwise, those Morganas might get away!
I know, but at this speed, we might lose control!
You know me, Capitano! I live life on the edge! I'm just sad these engines can't go any faster!
We almost hit that reef back there!
But we didn't. Hold on, things might get a little bumpy!

Fields.MenuText: Slow and steady wins the race, they say.
What if the Morgana reverses course and we crash right into her?
Just keep things together, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: The tortoise and the hare? Well, I'm proud to be a strong tortoise, birthed with a rich history - and a yearning to surpass the hare and even the hawk!
Then we'll sue her for the damages. Why not?
No worries, I have everything under control. Trust me, I live for this kind of chase.
Well, you need to slow down now, Lampo. We're coming into range.
Sì, Capitano! Now the real action can begin.
@BATTLE
Capitano, can I speed up? Per favore?
Sorry, Lampo, but until this fog clears, it's best to play it safe.
But I'm getting cabin fever, just waiting around with no end in sight. Isn't there something we can do?
If we don't keep quiet, the ambush we've set up will fall apart. Just stay patient a little longer, please?
Well, that Morgana had better hurry up and get here, or we'll just have to find her ourselves.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you work on some of your technical projects?
You could get some rest.
The fog is kind of pretty, don't you think?

Fields.DialogueText: I already have. Sure, I like tinkering with things, but force me to stick with one thing for too long and I get a little crazy.
Silly! You know that we Bellissimi Fantasmi have no need for slumber. Or, at least, I don't. I hear some of the girls do sleep and dream, though...
Hai ragione - absolutely. And I want to see what's behind the veil.
The mist is clearing, Lampo. Get ready.
Finalmente! It was a pain just sitting around.
Really? I hadn't noticed.
Sarcasm doesn't become you, Capitano. Although I suppose it probably wasn't as bad as I made it out to be.
I'm glad to hear you admit as much. You ready?
Ready! Andiamo!
@BATTLE
I really think you should slow down a little, Lampo.
Questo è completamente inutile! Everything is running smoother than ever.
I know that, but I'm concerned that you're following that Morgana a little too closely. Maybe we should fall back for the moment.
But then we'd have to let this one get away. Just give me a minute or two, and I'll be right on her!
That's what worries me. You're keeping an eye out for potential reinforcements, right?
Sì! Of course I am. I've kept track of all the Morganas in the area.
Wait, all of them?
The others are closing in around us at this very moment.
What?! Why didn't you turn around?
It was too late by the time I noticed. Nothing to do but get into the fray and fight. So what are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: First of all, respect my authority. You need to share these things with me, and listen to my advice.
Get ready for battle. But in the future, learn to rein in your recklessness.
Damn it, Lampo! Are you trying to get us killed?!

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, Capitano. Mi dispiace. I'll try to be more open with you.
I guess you're right. This was a little too brash, even for me. I will not fail in my duty to my nation and the world.
I don't like this any more than you do, but what's the use in giving up? We have to fight, and stay strong.
I... just don't like how you ignore me, Lampo. You never admit what you really know or think unless I push hard enough. We need to trust each other if we want to work as a team.
I... just worry that you might not like my ideas, like you did just now. But you're right, I need to be more disciplined in following your orders.
I might have approved of your strategy if you had informed me properly.
Grazie, Capitano. I'll try to share things with you.
Good. Now, we just have to get out of this mess. Think you can handle these enemies?
Heh, these Morganas are foolish, surrounding us like this. It just ensures that we have plenty of targets to go around.
@BATTLE
Capitano, can we talk?
That's supposed to be my line. But what is it?
I... wanted to get more of your thoughts on Aetherial Babylon.
The painting?
No, that's the name I came up with for my main project - the sky city.
You want my help with it?
Sì. I'm trying to find a good balance between functionality and creativity. I want this to be more than just a weapon or tool - I want there to be something more.
More?
Race tracks, gardens, cafes - something with a sense of humanity to it. But I'm worried that headquarters won't approve of it. Any thoughts?

Fields.MenuText: So you've been testing the waters with your various improvement schemes for the ship, then?
You want it to be something that carries on for generations.
Well, first of all, what made you go with a floating city? What do you want to get out of it?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, and those tests have been really helpful. I appreciate all of the insights you've given.
Few people know the names of Caesar's top commanders, but the monuments are still there. Wars come and go, but other things last for eternity. That's the mark I want to leave on the world.
I'm... not sure. Maybe... I want to reach the sky? Yes, that's why. I want to fly to new heights while proudly carrying my heritage with me.
Do you have any more ideas, Capitano?
Just... don't let up, Lampo. You don't need to worry about pleasing everyone if you're happy with what you're doing. I'm sure that your city will be amazing.
Grazie, Capitano.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Have you spotted any Morganas yet, Lampo?
No. Non ancora. Just like Scylla and Charybdis, though, you never know what's lurking beneath the surface. I wonder if they were what sank the Titanic.
You mean unseen things beneath the surface?
No, I meant the Morganas. Maybe they used the Titanic as a warm-up.
Considering their grand entrance on the first of September, I doubt that's the case.
I know, but I just wonder sometimes. How long will this war drag on? Do you think we will ever be able to go home?

Fields.MenuText: Are you giving up that easily?
We can't give up on the future.
We can make a home for ourselves no matter where we are.

Fields.DialogueText: Ovviamente no! Are you kidding me? I would just like to be free to pursue other interests... at some point in time.
È vero. If we get too caught up in the pains of the present, we might forget what's in store for us in the future. There is hope for us, yet.
È vero. It has been really nice, having you and everyone here for me. Let's make sure our bonds endure.
I think I can make out a Scylla in the distance.
More like a Hydra. The trouble never seems to end.
Well, we'll just have to keep lopping off the heads until they retreat, once and for all. Forward!
@BATTLE
Ha ha ha ha ha! "Which one?" "Make up your mind!" That buffoon!
Lampo, can you hear me?
Oh, scusa, Capitano. I was just listening to this recording.
What is it, some opera from Italy?
Not exactly. It's a comedic play - "Servant of Two Masters." It's actually quite funny once you get into it.
Tell me about it.
The name says it all. This rather silly fop of a footman offers his services independently to two separate people. And then he has to balance their separate orders without mixing things up!
Goodness, you're really quite the fan, aren't you?
You bet I am! Why he shackled himself to two contrary masters is beyond...
Lampo, what's wrong?
Capitano? What do you think is going to happen after the war?
You mean... ?
My service to my home has always been my greatest honor. But... I've made so many friends here, and I cannot let them - or you - down, either. What are we going to do?

Fields.MenuText: Everything will work out, you'll see.
Go with your gut and decide what's right.
You shouldn't have to sacrifice one bond for the sake of another.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Sorry, I don't know what came over me.
I guess that's all I can do, in the end. No matter what happens, I will not give up on my friends!
... I guess not. But personal feelings must be yielded if necessary for the glory of Italy. At least, that is what I was always told.
Let's worry about that another day. Right now, we need to make sure that we all have homes to go back to.
Right. For the glories of our homelands and bonds, let's crush these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Lampo, something is confusing me.
Che cosa? What's on your mind?
You say that you're worried about your ideas being used only for warfare.
Yes. I want something that is useful in the long term, not just for today's objectives.
But you yourself are a weapon.
Sì. So I am. I... should get back to work.
Lampo, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have asked.
Non preoccuparti, Capitano. It's okay.
You're right. I am a warship. I don't know what purpose I will have after the war. What will happen to me?

Fields.MenuText: You should take pride in who you are now. Even as a warship, you have done many great things. Without you, who knows where I'd be?
You're more than a warship, Lampo. You're a creative thinker and maker.
Just because your objective is war in the present doesn't mean it must be war in the future.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I am Lampo, a proud fighter for Italy and the world. Whatever else, I will stop the Morganas, and bring new hope to the planet.
Grazie, Capitano. You're right. That's part of why I want to make Aetherial Babylon, I guess. If we can create things on our own, then we can give meaning to our lives as well.
... That's a good point. Maybe that's why we awakened - to find a new bridge between war and peace. Or maybe it's just because Juno farted in the bathtub. But we won't know unless we try.
If it helps, Lampo, I don't view you as a weapon. I just see you... as my friend.
... Grazie, Capitano. So why are we just sitting around here, moping? I can make out a Morgana just over there. Andiamo!
Right behind you.
@BATTLE
Say, Capitano?
Yes?
I was thinking - what we really need to improve morale is a race.
I told you, we can't fit in a race track right now. And I'm not sure how many sailors would know how to drive.
We might not have any Nuvolaris with us right now, but it just takes time and practice. But that's not what I'm asking for.
It's not?
No. What I want is a ship race - one between the Belles. Can we, please?

Fields.MenuText: What would we do for the prize?
What if there's an attack in the middle of the race?
Who would referee?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. Maybe I could make something, like a musical lifeboat.
Then we'll make sure they regret interrupting our little tournament. We already know to stay alert at all times, so they won't catch us off guard.
That is a problem. I don't want to force anyone to stay out of the race, but then who can watch for who wins? What if we built a floating camera buoy to capture the whole race?
I'll think about it. I can say that it does have a better chance than your earlier suggestion. You've come a long way with your ideas.
Grazie. I'll just have to keep trying my hardest.
Although, now I'm wondering about a different kind of race...
Huh? What now?
A Morgana race.
And how would that work?
È semplice! See those Morganas over there? We chase them, and if we catch up with them, we win the prize of taking them down.
That is one game we can all enjoy. Prepare to close in!
@BATTLE
I guess that's one way to lighten the mood if you need to use it.
Only you could think of something so inventive in such an unusual circumstance, Lampo.
Why, thank you!
Lampo, did you finish checking the perimeter?
Sì - but I should probably check again soon. Good call.
Thanks. I'm glad you're working to keep on top of things.
Out of curiosity, what's with that ball gown hanging there?
Oh, that?
Do you like it?
Well, yes... but that's not the point. Why do you have it?
Oh, I thought it would be nice to get dressed up and have some Aglianico. Would you like to join me?
I must remind you...
I know I didn't exactly get permission to bring this aboard, but I promise I'll be discreet.
So, do you think I'll look good in this?

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you worried the dress might get wrinkled?
I think you'll look nice.
It's an unusual mixture of tastes, but I think it will suit you well.

Fields.DialogueText: Certamente - but that's just a risk I'll have to take. Just like on the track or on the seas, you have to live life on the edge.
Grazie. I don't have the time to show this side of myself often, but it's always a delight when I do.
You really understand me, don't you, Capitano? Yes, I am a multi-sided woman - one of grace, one of grit, one of duty, another of freedom.
So, mio caro Capitano, once I'm dressed up, would you care for a short dance?
If it would make you happy.
*ALARM*
I guess my perimeter scans are overdue?
Full steam ahead. They'll regret haunting these waters.
That's the way. Now to show how a lady can gracefully demolish her enemies!
@BATTLE
Hello, Lampo. Enjoying the view?
Sì. It's really beautiful, isn't it?
Yes, it is rather pretty. And the waves are calm, too.
It is nice. Say, Capitano?
What?
Can we go to the moon sometime?
What?!
That would be quite an adventure, wouldn't it?
I guess that's one way to look at it.
What sort of propulsion system do you think could get us up there? Rockets?

Fields.MenuText: That's not really my area of expertise.
What will you use to keep Aetherial Babylon in the air?
Why do you want to go there?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's not mine either, but that's no reason not to think about it.
Actually, I'm still figuring that out. Maybe if we can solve one of these puzzles, we can kill two birds with one stone.
Do I need a reason? But if you insist on hearing one, it's because no one has done it yet. Meaning that it offers a new path for humanity to grow.
Some days I wonder if you'll ever run out of ideas.
I certainly hope not. But, Capitano...
What?
I think I know what I want out of my Babylon idea. I want to be able to touch the sea and the sky. To pull them together in harmony.
Well, make a wish on the moon, and maybe it will happen.
I made a wish, but not for that. I'll fulfill the wish myself. Besides, hopefully, my wish for success against the incoming Morganas comes true.
@BATTLE
I don't like the look of that storm, Lampo.
Non preoccuparti, Capitano. Just a quick push through, and wham! We'll be out on the other side.
We could skirt around it.
But then the Morgana might escape before we reach her. You know that.
I know, I just don't like it.
Well, just don't let that gloom affect you too much. What are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: Stay on course!
Prepare the crew for a fight.
Push through as fast as safety permits.

Fields.DialogueText: Sì, Capitano! I'm not letting that Morgana get away.
Sì, Capitano!
That's just the order I love. Hang on tight!
... Look, the storm is already clearing up! See, Capitano, it wasn't that bad.
Easy for you to say - I almost choked on a spray of seawater.
Well, no use crying over spilled rain. We have that Morgana right where we want her, so let's make this count!
Next time, we're taking the detour.
@BATTLE
Capitano, great news!
What is it?
I think I finally finished the specs for Aetherial Babylon!
Excellent, Lampo! I'm really proud of you. Are you going to submit it?
That would be the next step, wouldn't it?
What are you worried about?
It's just... I don't know what my superiors at the Naval Academy are going to think of it. They could find it intriguing... or they could find it crazy.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should try to present it in a way that appeals to their goals.
You won't know until you try.
Why are you so worried about their approval?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just hoping they won't twist it to suit their own goals.
È vero. No use hesitating when I'm at the starting line. I just have to rush forward and pray for the best.
What else can I do?! If they find it problematic, I'll have no choice but to heed their wisdom.
Well, wish me luck.
Good luck. And remember - you've had my support throughout this entire process, and you'll continue to have it moving forward.
I know you were just humoring me.
Maybe at first, but now? Well, I want to see you succeed.
Grazie, Capitano. Oh, and look at that - more Morganas. They certainly know how to wrap up a chat.
Get ready for battle. It looks like they won't go down easily.
@BATTLE
I thought you said this was for the world as a whole. Why do you need them in particular?
... It's my duty, and if nothing else, I will honor my heritage.
What are you up to, Lampo?
Well, I have to wait for the answers on the city project for now, so I'm trying to pass my time with other things.
Like building a race car, I see. If this is about another race track idea, we'll have to wait. It could work, but you should probably try it on a civilian vessel first.
Oh, no. While this could be used on a sea track if I get your permission, it's for a land race.
Are races still going on with the war going on?
Most have stopped, but that means the competition will be fierce once the war ends, so best to be ready.
Are you planning to enter the race when the time comes?
No... but I was wondering if you might be interested.
Me?
Sì! I could give you coaching and the best equipment. Would you consider it?

Fields.MenuText: Shouldn't you look for someone more experienced?
Why pick me?
Do you think we can win?

Fields.DialogueText: You're experienced already, Capitano - in being friends with me! We're partners, and that's the most important thing for winning anything.
Because you're you, Capitano. I couldn't think of anyone else I'd want driving my creation more.
We can win if we both put our hearts into this! And besides... it's the challenge and excitement that counts. Doing the impossible together.
So, are you in?
I might as well, or you'll never let me hear the end of it. Now, I think that's a Morgana coming into range.
Taking my strategy, eh? No matter. We'll mop up this rabble and get on with the training.
@BATTLE
Not even Tazio Nuvolari?
Of course not - then we wouldn't have a chance to race against him.
Hello, Lampo.
Ehi, Capitano.
What's wrong?
I got a reply about my special project.
And... ?
I don't know. All they said in the note was a brief thanks for my work, and a statement that they would take it "into consideration." Nothing else.
Maybe that means they'll use it.
Maybe. Pola has a different opinion on that.
What did she say now?
She wondered if I want to live in the sky because my head is in the clouds. And that... I'm wasting time and resources with my nonsense.

Fields.MenuText: Do you want me to have a talk with her?
The Italians should all be proud of you! If they aren't, that's their own loss.
But, do you think you did a good job? In the end, that's all that matters.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not necessary! I'd really rather not be on the receiving end of one of Pola's punches.
I hope one day they will be proud of me.
... Sì, I think I did. I don't know why the Naval Academy didn't like my idea more.
Anyway, cheer up. You just have to keep trying. I believe in you.
Grazie, Capitano. That means a lot to me. I...
*ALARM*
Puh! Do you monsters have the worst timing on purpose? Oh, well, at least I can let out some of my frustration.
Just remember - I'm here for you, Lampo.
@BATTLE
Maybe they just have a different view of things.
Maybe. Or maybe my dream doesn't mean as much to them as it does to me.
Capitano, remember that lunar expedition I suggested earlier? You never said if rockets or jet engines would work best for getting up there.
I didn't. And I was hoping that I would not need to answer.
Va bene. I have something different in mind this time.
Somehow, that fails to reassure me.
I was thinking, what my sky city idea needs to get going is solid evidence to stand on - metaphorically, that is. What if I used myself as a demonstration?

Fields.MenuText: Will that really solve your main dilemma with your superiors?
If that's what you want to do, I will support you.
It will take a lot of hard work to get there. Are you willing to go all the way?

Fields.DialogueText: ... I guess I'm not sure it will. I really need to think about why they turned me down and what I'm going to do about it.
Thank you, thank you, thank you! I'll work extra hard, you can count on me! Let's reach the sky together!
... I'm prepared for that, yes. Maybe I have only been thinking of all this as creative fun. But I truly wish for my dreams to become reality. Together, I know we can succeed!
I'm glad that you're not giving up, Lampo, even if it inevitably leads to more headaches on my end. You just need to see the value in your efforts.
I really do appreciate your support, Capitano.
Good to know I can be of help. How about you repay the favor by helping me deal with these Morganas?
I'll take them down, on the double! Andiamo!
@BATTLE
I don't know where the future will lead us, Lampo, but I'm sure we can find our way through it.
No doubt about that. So let's charge toward the challenges! We will achieve our goals.
Speaking of charging toward challenges...
Everyone to your stations! Nemici in arrivo!
@BATTLE
Well, another day, another brawl, I guess. Thanks for having my back during that scrape.
Non era niente di speciale. Just doing my duty.
Don't downplay what you did out there. You are great!
Those goons didn't stand a chance. But... I'd protect you even if you forgot to ask.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, we're partners. I'd protect you too.
I'd protect you with my life, Lampo.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear it, Capitano!
Th... that's so sweet of you to say, Capitano. Thank you.
